greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Restricted growth sequence transform of ((-1)^n)*A046523(n); filter combining the parity and the prime signature of n.
comment: Equally, restricted growth sequence transform of sequence b defined as b(1) = 1, and for n > 1, b(n) = A046523(n) + A000035(n), which starts as 1, 2, 3, 4, 3, 6, 3, 8, 5, 6, 3, 12, 3, 6, 7, 16, 3, 12, 3, 12, ...
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
program: rgs_transform(invec) = { my(om = Map(), outvec = vector(length(invec)), u=1); for(i=1, length(invec), if(mapisdefined(om,invec[i]), my(pp = mapget(om, invec[i])); outvec[i] = outvec[pp] , mapput(om,invec[i],i); outvec[i] = u; u++ )); outvec; };
A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ This function from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011
xref: Cf. A046523, A101296, A286161, A286251, A286367, A291762 (related or similar filtering sequences).
Cf. A065091 (positions of 3's), A100484 (of 4 and 5's), A001248 (of 4 and 7's), A046388 (of 9's), A030078 (of 6 and 12's).
Cf. A098108 (one of the matching sequences).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 11 2017
